model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I am thinking about getting a new tattoo for my mom to match the one for my dad. What do you think?

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Speaker A is a tattoo enthusiast who works at a coffee shop and hails from San Francisco. They have a total of 5 tattoos, with their favorite being one dedicated to their late father with the inscription "for you I shall live". Speaker A is currently saving up for a portrait of their father's face next to a slogan on their chest in memory.

Relationship Description:
In the dialogue, Speaker A and Speaker B show a friendly and engaging relationship. Speaker B shows genuine interest and support towards Speaker A's plans for their tattoo, expressing admiration for the idea of getting a portrait of Speaker A's father's face.

Event Description:
The events shared between Speaker A and Speaker B involve discussions about their respective trips to fishing destinations. They talk about fishing plans off the California coast, as well as specific locations like Humboldt County. Speaker A provides recommendations for places to visit, such as Fort Humboldt State Park, Sequoia Park Forest and Garden, and the Carson Mansion. They also discuss the potential risks of car burglaries in certain areas. Speaker A expresses their goal of visiting every national park in the US, showcasing a shared interest in exploring different places.

raw_prediction:
Speaker A: I actually haven't done much graffiti lately, but I did put up a large mural on the side of the local Community Center. People seem to like it, but the administrators of the center are not too happy about it. Everyone is trying to figure out who did it.

Speaker B: That's pretty cool! It must be exciting to see people's reactions to your art. Hopefully, the administrators will come around and appreciate the creativity behind it.

Speaker A: Yeah, I hope so too. It's always a risk putting up street art, but I feel like it's worth it to bring some color and creativity to the community.

Speaker B: Absolutely, art has a way of bringing people together and sparking conversations. Keep up the good work, and maybe one day your art will be officially commissioned!

Speaker A: Thanks, that means a lot coming from you. It's always encouraging to hear positive feedback. And who knows, maybe one day I'll have my own art exhibit showcasing my work.

Speaker B: That would be amazing! I'll definitely be the first in line to see your exhibit. Keep following your passion, and great things will come your way.
